name: AddTagsToResource
description: Adds metadata tags to an DMS resource, including replication instance, endpoint, subnet group, and migration task. These tags can also be used with cost allocation reporting to track cost associated with DMS resources, or used in a Condition statement in an IAM policy for DMS. For more information, see Tag data type description.

AddTagsToResourceMessage.title: AddTagsToResourceMessage

allOf.description:
Identifies the DMS resource to which tags should be added. The value for this parameter is an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

For DMS, you can tag a replication instance, an endpoint, or a replication task.
One or more tags to be assigned to the resource.

AddTagsToResourceMessage.description: Associates a set of tags with an DMS resource.

allOf.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be 1-128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular expressions: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").

A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be 1-256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with "aws:" or "dms:". The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, '_', '.', '/', '=', '+', '-' (Java regular expressions: "^([\\p{L}\\p{Z}\\p{N}_.:/=+\\-]*)$").
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) string that uniquely identifies the resource for which the tag is created.

Tag.description:
A user-defined key-value pair that describes metadata added to an DMS resource and that is used by operations such as the following:

  • AddTagsToResource

  • ListTagsForResource

  • RemoveTagsFromResource
